Title: Communities experiencing racial inequity
Description: Organisations working on racial justice or supporting people from multiple communities

Title: Black / African / Caribbean / Black British
Description: Mixed Black/ Black British

Title: Any other Black/ African/ Caribbean background
Mixed
Description: Mixed groups

Title: Any other Mixed / Multiple ethnic background
Asian / Asian British
Description: Mixed Asian/ Asian British

Title: Other Group experiencing ethnic or racial inequity
Disabled people
Description: Working with people across multiple disabilities

Title: Physical Impairment
Description: Working with people with multiple or different physical impairments

Title: Mobility
Description: Physical/mobility impairment, such as a difficulty using your arms or mobility issues which require you to use a wheelchair or crutches

Title: Visual impairment/ partial sight/sight loss
Description: Visual impairment, such as being blind or having a serious visual impairment

Title: Hard of hearing/ deaf/ hearing loss
Description: Hearing impairment, such as being deaf or having a serious hearing impairment

Title: Speech impairment
Description: Impaired ability to produce speech sounds

Title: Mental Health
Description: Mental health condition or experience, such as depression or psychosis or addiction that impacts people’s lives

Title: Cognitive differences
Description: Multiple or different cognitive differences

Title: Learning disability
Description: A reduced intellectual ability and difficulty with everyday activities which affects someone for their whole life, such as Down’s Syndrome

Title: Learning difficulty
Description: Learning difficulties such as dyslexia and ADHD

Title: Neurodivergent
Description: Cognitive difference such as autistic spectrum disorder where individuals are impacted by the social environment

Title: Health
Description: Long-standing illness or health condition, such as cancer, HIV, diabetes, chronic heart disease or epilepsy, or other rare conditions

Title: Other
Description: Other - An impairment, medical condition or environmental disadvantage that is not listed above

Title: Faith
Description: Interfaith and multi-faith groups

Title: Catholic
Description: People who describe their faith as Catholic or Roman Catholic

Title: Protestant
Description: Anglicans, Adventists, Baptists, Methodists, Pentecostals, Presbyterians, Religious Society of Friends, Reformed Churches and other Protestant denominations

Title: Other Christian denominations
Description: Orthodox and other denominations

Title: Other
Description: Other faiths and beliefs

Title: LGBT+ People
Description: Working with LGBT+ people with multiple identities

Title: Bisexual people
Description: All bisexual people

Title: Transgender people
Description: All transgender people

Title: Other
Description: Other LGBT+ People, including queer and intersex people

Title: Migrants
Description: Migrants with multiple status

Title: Other Migrants
Description: This includes other migrants with official immigration status, e.g. international students; and who are naturalised British

Title: Older People
Description: Typically those aged 60 and over

Title: Children and Young People
Description: Typically people under 26 but sometimes people under 19

Title: Young adults
Description: Typically young people from 16 to 25 years of age

Title: Young people
Description: Typically young people from 8 to 25

Title: Children
Description: Under 16

Title: Infants
Description: Under 2 years of age

Title: People who are educationally or economically disadvantaged
Description: This will be defined by the organisation, such as children eligible for free school meals or for adults were eligible for free school meals as a child, families receiving benefits or universal credit, people who are homeless, people who did not complete formal education or otherwise considered in deprivation or poverty etc.

Title: Women and girls
Description: Those who identify and live as women and girls
